ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: The class was focusing a lot on the work process of creating documentary films. The weekly screenings and subsequent talks with filmmakers gave valuable insight into their approach to make documentary films - to execute camerawork, engage with performers and documented people, and editing. Parallelly, I was developing my own project, to which Charlie was giving feedback on a regular basis.
how to produce, shoot, and edit a documentary.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
strengths: screenings! we got great opportunities to meet filmmakers and watch a diversity of influential films.

Weaknesses: The course felt. poorly planned and Professor didn't do a great job of facilitating collaboration, film development, etc for students. We didn't learn many skills in the course.

It is very open in its format and structure, and I perceived it mostly as environment where I can work on my own projects, but having the chance to receive feedback, and to get input supporting my own work.

Strength are that the community of people who choose to do this course are awesome. Weaknesses is that there is little to no guidance on the practical skills needed to produce the documentary (very little camera and editing training) and very little structure to the course.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would certainly recommend to people who are committed to do a large project, either on their own or directly within the framework of the course. The person should, however, be able to structure the semester for themselves and to work independently.
Yes, if you want to do a documentary and have the necessary camera and editing skills.
